noun.description: Belief that union with or absorption into the Deity or the absolute, or the spiritual apprehension of knowledge inaccessible to the intellect, may be attained through contemplation and self-surrender.
examples: St. Theresa's writings were part of the tradition of Christian mysticism

noun.description: Belief characterized by self-delusion or dreamy confusion of thought, especially when based on the assumption of occult qualities or mysterious agencies.
examples: there is a hint of New Age mysticism in the show's title
